events.text: Printing press invented by Gutenberg
Telegraph patented by Morse
Telephone invented by Bell
First radio broadcast
First email sent
Hot air balloon flight by the Montgolfier brothers
First steam locomotive by Trevithick
Karl Benz patents the first automobile
Wright brothers achieve powered flight
First commercial jet airliner service (de Havilland Comet)
Edward Jenner develops the smallpox vaccine
Ether first used as surgical anesthesia
X-rays discovered by Wilhelm Roentgen
Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin
First successful human heart transplant
Sewing machine patented by Elias Howe
First practical electric vacuum cleaner
Electric washing machine introduced
Home refrigerator becomes widely available
Microwave oven introduced for home use
Phonograph invented by Edison
First public movie screening by the Lumiere brothers
First regular television broadcasts begin
First home video game console (Magnavox Odyssey)
Compact disc (CD) introduced
Charles Babbage designs the Analytical Engine
ENIAC, the first general-purpose computer, is completed
First microprocessor (Intel 4004) released
Apple Macintosh introduces the graphical user interface to consumers
World Wide Web made publicly available
First permanent photograph taken by Niepce
Kodak introduces the handheld camera
First feature-length talking film (The Jazz Singer)
Polaroid instant camera released
First consumer digital camera (Dycam Model 1)
James Watt improves the steam engine
First practical electric light bulb by Edison
First hydroelectric power plant opens (Niagara Falls)
First nuclear power plant generates electricity
First practical silicon solar cell developed at Bell Labs
Nicolas Appert invents canning for food preservation
Pasteurization process developed by Louis Pasteur
Mechanical refrigeration for food transport
Clarence Birdseye develops flash-freezing for food
First genetically modified food approved for sale
Robert Goddard launches the first liquid-fueled rocket
Sputnik becomes the first artificial satellite in orbit
Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human in space
Apollo 11 lands the first humans on the Moon
International Space Station receives its first crew
